hackathon-rules:
- You must be at the event in order to qualify
- You cannot work on your project before the event begins; all private code must be made at the event.
- Open source code bases are okay to use, but teams must write create a significant portion of the project themselves.
- You cannot steal someone else's code; that's bad and illegal
- All decisions made by the judges are final
- Follow the

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: In honor of Professor Garverick, this prize is given to the most outstanding hardware hack; $500 Amazon Gift Card.

Digital Health includes all or elements of mHealth (aka Mobile Health), Wireless Health, Health 2.0, eHealth, Health IT, Big Data, Health Data, Cloud Computing, e-Patients, Quantified Self and Self-tracking, Wearable Computing, Gamification, Telehealth & Telemedicine, Precision and Personalized Medicine, plus Connected Health.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=10900 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, OH 44106, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Design is clean and intuitive, user experience is friendly and doesn't leave the user scarred for life
Explanation is clear and informative, hack is engaging, entertaining, and educational.
Hack makes use of advanced technologies to accomplish a complex tastl
Has potential for social, political, economic, or environmental of great proportions.
Product is original, not simply a knock off or fad of another existing hack

hackathon-description-header: Push beyond the realms of conventional hacks using our makerspace facilities and available labs to create something the like of which the world has never seen before!
